page.title: 11SOUTH STOKE IN THE ARUN GAP
page.content: South Stoke, a farming village North-east of Arundel, is approached along a two mile cul-de-sac road. It is surrounded on three sides by the Arun, where the wet-lands provide grazing for cattle. South of the village the higher ground provides for arable crops. This farm is one of a four-some run by a tenant farmer. A few cottages, the old rectory and the candle-lit church form the community. Deciduous trees line the lanes and fields. The sheep summer in Wales, transported by truck - 360 per truck. They return in October to graze the unburnt stubble and turnip strips.Sep- tic tanks provide sanitation, there is no gas. Wood and coal heat the homes. Milk and papers are collected from two miles distance. The only child is taxied to school. Only the dustcart calls. It is beautiful and remote.
